message.content:
cs.DC, cs.CE, cs.NI, cs.SE, cs.PF 

This paper discusses resource allocation policies for running compute-intensive jobs on spot instances in cloud computing. The primary focus is on optimizing the use of variable-priced virtual machines to create cost-effective virtual clusters. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). Other likely categories include cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science), cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture), cs.SE (Software Engineering), and cs.PF (Performance).
